title: Split README and add GORYDETAILS
description: Refactor documentation so README stays user-focused: repair the 'sk config get' HTML damage, strip salesy language, assume default_root=skills in quickstart, replace the repo list section with an 'anthropic' repo entry and example output from 'sk repo list', and move the detailed machine-readable listing plus deeper explanations into a new GORYDETAILS.md.

title: Refine README quickstart and add test coverage
description: Update README.md so the quickstart shows installing sk from crates.io, installing actual Anthropic skills by name, running sk doctor, and creating/pushing to a personal skills repo via gh. Remove the --https mention from the quickstart. Add an automated test (e.g., doctest/integration test) that exercises the documented quickstart flow so regressions are caught.

title: Add `sk template create` CLI
description: Implement a first-class 'sk template create <name> "<description>"' subcommand that copies a configurable template skill into 'skills/<name>', rewrites SKILL.md metadata, and drops stub prompt/test files. Hook it into the config system so it always: (1) pulls the template from 'template_source' (default '@anthropics/skills template-skill'), (2) writes into 'default_root' (default './skills'), (3) rewrites SKILL.md name + description from the two CLI args, and (4) leaves stub prompt/test files ready for editing. Ensure it reuses cached clones, surfaces useful errors, and add tests covering the README workflow.
acceptance_criteria: Running 'sk template create retro-template "Retro two-column recap template"' copies from the configured template source into skills/retro-template without extra flags. 'sk config set template_source ...' and 'sk config set default_root ...' change behavior for subsequent runs. Generated SKILL.md matches the CLI-provided name/description and stub prompt/test files exist. Automated tests cover the default flow plus a config override.

title: Make sync-back auto-open PRs and report conflicts
description: Extend sk sync-back so every push also opens a GitHub PR (using gh), auto-merges it when clean, and surfaces conflicts with a link when auto-merge fails. This should be the default behavior (no separate mode) and still avoid failing when unrelated files change.

title: Remove lockfile ref support
description: Simplify sk by removing the legacy --ref CLI flag, lockfile ref field, and pinned-upgrade semantics so installs/upgrades always follow the remote default branch.

title: check sk status and update cleanliness
Fix README command cheat sheet formatting
description: The README command cheat sheet row for `sk upgrade` still contains an inline `|` token that GitHub treats as a table delimiter, so the rendered table shows a blank cell or stray HTML comments. Update the row so it no longer includes raw `|` characters inside the code span, keeping the wording readable.

title: Draft release-ready README with quickstart workflows
description: Add a comprehensive README that explains how to use sk with the default Anthropic skills repo and a user repo, including quickstart steps for pointing sk at a repo, publishing a new skill, running `sk doctor` to inspect changes, and using sync-back. Document dependencies like the GitHub CLI (`gh`).

title: Document sync-back new skill usage
description: Add clearer instructions documenting how to publish brand-new skills via 'sk sync-back --repo --skill-path', including what branch name is used and how it surfaces in CLI output.

title: Simplify `sk sync-back` defaults
description: Update 'sk sync-back' so it infers the repo, branch name, and skill-path automatically: read the push target from 'default_repo', use the install name for the skill path, auto-generate 'sk/sync/<name>/<timestamp>' branches, and only require overriding flags when users explicitly provide them. Ensure missing 'rsync' or 'gh' emit warnings but fall back to slower copies / manual PR instructions instead of failing. Align the CLI behavior with the README examples (only optional '-m' argument in the quickstart).
acceptance_criteria: - Running 'sk sync-back frontend-design -m ...' pushes to the repo configured via 'sk config set default_repo' with no additional flags. - When 'default_repo' is unset, the CLI errors with a helpful message describing how to set it. - Branch names default to 'sk/sync/<name>/<timestamp>' but can still be overridden. - Missing 'rsync' triggers a warning and falls back to a recursive copy; missing 'gh' still pushes and emits a warning to open the PR manually. - Tests cover the default flow plus the warning paths.

title: Force git archive to bypass autocrlf in extract paths
description: The new digest refresh flow broke Windows CI because `git archive` was honoring the runnerâ€™s `core.autocrlf=true` setting, so reinstalling after auto-merge wrote CRLF while the merged commit remained LF. As a result `sync_back_refreshes_local_digest_to_merged_commit` failed (`remote v2\n` vs `remote v2\r\n`) and the lock digest could diverge per OS. We need to run every `git archive` we invoke (install, doctor rebuilds, upgrade staging, template create) with `core.autocrlf=false` so extracted files always match the committed bytes regardless of host defaults.

title: Ensure sk sync-back refreshes skills.lock after upstream merge
description:
Repro (reported by user):
1. Run 'sk install @lambdamechanic/skills dumbwaiter-mcp'.
2. Make local edits, then run 'sk sync-back dumbwaiter-mcp --repo @lambdamechanic/skills --skill-path dumbwaiter-mcp'.
3. Wait for the PR to merge upstream.

Even though local files match the merged commit, skills.lock.json still points at the pre-PR commit. 'sk doctor' warns 'Upgrade available (old -> new)' and 'sk status --json' shows the same, because the lock entry never updated.

Expectation: a successful sync-back (plus auto-merge) should bump the lock to the merged commit so the local install is considered up-to-date.

Task: teach 'sk sync-back' to refresh skills.lock.json to the merged commit whenever the push/PR succeeds (or when --repo/branch overrides are used) so users don't immediately get upgrade warnings.

title: Refresh local install digest when auto-merge rewrites commit
description: PR #22 adds logic to bump the lock entry to the GitHub merge commit when sync-back auto-merge succeeds, but we still leave the local skill directory (and its digest) at the pre-merge tree. If upstream main advanced after we started editing, the merge commit can contain extra changes that never make it back into the local install, so `skills.lock.json` ends up with the merge commit SHA but the digest of the old tree. Need to rehydrate the install directory from the merged commit and recompute the digest so local files match what landed.

title: dogfood sk to manage repo skills
Align repo list output with README
description: Teach 'sk repo list' to emit the table shown in the README (alias, host/owner/repo, skill counts) and include counts for available and installed skills. Update the README sample output and docs (including GORYDETAILS) accordingly.

title: Fix clippy failure in auto-merge tip path
description: PR #22 (`sk-z5m-repo-add`) is failing the CI `cargo clippy --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings` job due to a new `needless_borrow` lint at `src/sync.rs:463` (`auto_merge_tip(&reason, spec)`). We need to remove the redundant borrow so the build passes again before landing the lock-refresh fix.

title: sk lacks workflow for new skills
description: Need a first-class way to publish a brand-new skill (new skillPath) to the skills repo. Currently sk sync-back only works for installs already present in skills.lock.json, so we cannot add a fresh skill like 'sk' without manually editing the lockfile or pushing directly to upstream.

title: Add `sk repo add` command
description: Introduce a CLI subcommand that registers a remote skills repo in the local cache without copying any skill into ./skills. The command should clone (or update) the repo into the sk cache so that `sk list-repo <repo>` (or similar) can enumerate available skills before installing. It should hook into the existing config/default host parsing so users can run e.g. `sk repo add @anthropics/skills` or pass full git URLs, and it should reuse the same caching logic used by `sk install`. Update the README/quickstart to explain how to add a repo, inspect its catalog, and then install specific skills. Add tests that drive the new command to ensure the repo is cached and that subsequent `sk install` can target it without fetching again.
